interfaces.name: Author
interfaces.sourceCode:
import { Book } from './book.model'

export interface Author {
  id: number
  name: string
  about: string
  books: Book[]
  imageSmall?: string
  imageLarge?: string
  goodreadsLink?: string
  isSelected: boolean
}

interfaces.name: Book
interfaces.sourceCode:
export interface Book {
  id: string
  ownerId: string
  title: string
  author: string
  owned: boolean
  read: boolean
  favorite: boolean
  wishlist: boolean
  date: string
  isbn?: number
  original?: string
  language?: string
  publisher?: string
  year?: number
  pages?: number
  genres?: string[]
  collections?: string[]
  tags?: string[]
  notes?: string
  imageSmall?: string
  imageLarge?: string
  rating?: number
  isSelected?: boolean
  canBeSelected?: boolean
  goodreadsId?: number
  goodreadsLink?: string
  goodreadsAuthorId?: number
}

components.name: GridComponent
HomeComponent
components.templateData:
Book Lib

Your personal library. Everywhere you go.

  • Manually add books to your library with title, author, title in original language, publisher, year of publication and number of pages
  • Customize your books: give them a rating, separate them in categories such as favorite, owned, read or in wishlist and add personalized notes to them, like a review or thoughts you had while reading
  • Categorize and organize your books by adding tags and genres to them or adding them to a collection
  • BookLib allows you to separate your books in collections. Collections can have as many books as you want and can be organized any way you want
  • Have a favorite trilogy? Want to put together all those hundreds of books written by your favorite author? Create a new collection and organize your books according to your needs
  • Share updates about books and collections in your library with friends over Facebook or Twitter
  • Invite friends to create their own personal libraries and see what books they are reading or want to read next
  • Import book data from millions of books available in the Goodreads and Amazon databases
  • Connect your BookLib account to your Amazon or Goodreads account and import your book favorites and wishlist easily
  • Keep track of your favorite authors and their work by accessing the Goodreads database directly from BookLib
  • Tired of keeping tracking of your books in boring spreadsheet files? Import those files directly into BookLib and start managing your personal library in a much more intuitive way!
  • Access your personal library anywhere and show the world your impressive collection!

components.templateData:
Import library

Prepare your file

To import your library from a spreadsheet file (.xlsx, .csv), organize the information from your books according to the structure displayed below (without the headers):

{{displayTableInfo ? 'Hide' : 'Show'}}
Title Author Original title Publisher Pages Year Language Rating Owned Wishlist Read Favorite Book cover link
My Book John Doe My Book Publisher Inc. 300 1990 English 0 X X http://link-to-image.com/image.png
My Book John Doe Mi Libro 1990 Espaol 2 X http://link-to-image.com/image.png
My Book John Doe Mein Buch Publisher Inc. Deutsch 5 X X
Configure your attributes

To correctly import your books from a spreadsheet file, use the following formatting for the provided attributes:

{{displayAttributesInfo ? 'Hide' : 'Show'}}

  • Title : The title of the book (required).

  • Author: The author of the book (required).

  • Original title: The title in the original title of the book.

  • Publisher The publisher of this version of the book.

  • Pages: Page count of this version of the book. Should be a whole number larger than 0.

  • Year: The year of publication of the book. Should be a whole number larger than 0.

  • Language: The language in which this version of the book was written. The language should be available in the following list:

    • {{language}}

  • Rating: Your personal rating. Should be a whole number between 0 and 5.

  • Owned: Indicates if you own this book or not. Mark your owned books with an 'X', otherwise leave this field blank.

  • Wishlist: Indicates if this book is in your wishlist. Mark the books in your wishlist with an 'X', otherwise leave this field blank.

  • Read: Indicates if you've read this book or not. Mark the books you've read with an 'X', otherwise leave this field blank.

  • Favorite: Indicates if this books if one of your favorites or not. Mark your favorite books with an 'X', otherwise leave this field blank.

  • Image link: Provide an image link to the book cover.

Import your library

File format: .xlxs, .csv.

Choose your books

Choose which books you want to import:

{{displayBooksToImport ? 'Hide' : 'Show'}}

components.name: WelcomeComponent
components.templateData:
Welcome to your new digital library!

BookLib lets you organize your books in a smart way. Take a tour around the application and see what amazing features you can discover.
Books

Here you find ALL of your books. You can see them in tiles or in a list, organize them by name, author, language or year. You can also filter them, search them and add new books manually. This is where your library starts!

Collections

You can organize your books in collections, like series of books, trilogies or books that have something in common. Find all of your collections here, add new ones and manage your current ones.

Authors

Here you can find info about authors you follow. (This feature is still under development!)

Goodreads

Here you can connect to the Goodreads platform, import your library from your account, find books and authors and connect your current books to the Goodreads database. (This feature is still under development!)

Import

Here you can import your personal library from a customized spreadsheet and have all your books very easily uploaded to your digital library.

Don't display this message anymore

})

filterBook
variables.defaultValue:
book =>
  _.pick(book, [
    'id',
    'title',
    'author',
    'isbn',
    'original',
    'language',
    'publisher',
    'year',
    'pages',
    'imageSmall',
    'imageLarge',
    'goodreadsLink',
    'goodreadsId',
    'goodreadsAuthorId',

HttpGetAll
ignoreReturnFor
variables.defaultValue:
fn => args =>
  Promise.resolve()
    .then(() => fn(args))
    .then(() => args)

variables.name: LANGUAGES
variables.defaultValue:
objectToArray(_LANGUAGES)
  .map(language => upperCaseFirstLetter(language))
  .sort()

variables.name: notify
objectToArray
objectToArrayWithRef
parseAuthor
variables.defaultValue:
(author, books?) =>
  ({
    id: +author.id,
    name: author.name,
    about: author.about,
    books,
    imageSmall: author.small_image_url,
    imageLarge: author.large_image_url
      ? author.large_image_url
      : author.image_url,
    goodreadsLink: author.link,
  } as Author)

variables.name: parseAuthorId
parseAuthorName
parseBook
variables.defaultValue:
book =>
  ({
    title: book.title,
    author: parseAuthorName(book),
    isbn: book.isbn,
    publisher: book.publisher,
    year: book.publication_year,
    pages: book.num_pages,
    imageLarge: book.large_image_url ? book.large_image_url : book.image_url,
    imageSmall: book.small_image_url,
    goodreadsLink: book.link,
    goodreadsId: parseBookId(book),
    goodreadsAuthorId: parseAuthorId(book),
  } as Book)

variables.name: parseBookId
parseFirebaseAuthError
parseXml
removeSpaces
variables.defaultValue: (string: string) => string.replace(/\s/g, '')

variables.name: routes
routes
routes
variables.defaultValue:
[
  {
    path: '',
    component: BooksComponent,
    children: [
      { path: '', component: BooksHomeComponent },
      { path: 'new', component: AddBookComponent, pathMatch: 'full' },
      { path: 'find', component: FindBookComponent },
      { path: 'import/:goodreadsId', component: MatchBookComponent },
      { path: ':id', component: BookComponent },
      { path: ':id/edit', component: EditBookComponent },
    ],
  },
]

variables.name: unique
variables.defaultValue: array => _.uniq(array)

variables.name: upperCaseFirstLetter
variables.defaultValue:
(string: string) =>
  string.charAt(0).toUpperCase() + string.slice(1)

variables.name: USE_PROXY
variables.defaultValue: true
